page.title: 04Tamar Valley _ Employment
page.content: The west and east banks of the River Tamar provide a similar kind of{ {employment}even though it marks the boundary between two counties. The majority of people are self-employed and{farming}is the main occupation. Farms have either a dairy or beef herd alongside arable crops, one specialising in the sale of cream. During the season salmon are caught from designated pools and eels are becoming an established{trade}. Market gardens commercially produce flowers, fruit, vegetables and shrubs. Some businesses provide employent such as the Boatyard, Building Contractor, Wholesale Nursery and Helicopter Crop-Spraying. The{population}is mainly middle-class, a proportion being retired and the remainder working in nearby villages, towns or cities, many in education.
